summary: This document is an email chain between Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, discussing the scheduling of the trial in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence reveals coordination regarding witness availability and a defense request to postpone the trial.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding trial scheduling and witness availability for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose counsel requested a continuance of the trial.

connections.description: McCawley, as a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner, is acting as legal counsel for Maxwell, coordinating on trial scheduling matters.

events.title: Defense Requests Trial Continuance
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's counsel filed a letter requesting the trial be postponed to November 8, 2021.

events.title: Proposed Trial Start Date
events.description: A witness (name redacted) is indicated to be available to testify if the trial begins on this date.

keyFacts: Maxwell's defense team formally requested a continuance of her trial to November 8, 2021, as of April 22, 2021.
A key witness's availability was a central scheduling concern, with a preference for an early September 2021 trial date due to personal circumstances involving an anticipated adoption.
The email chain is a coordination effort between the defense (Sigrid McCawley) and the prosecution (AUSA) regarding witness availability and trial scheduling.
The document contains multiple redactions, notably the name of a witness and the specific Assistant U.S. Attorney.
